alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Tuscaloosa and southwestern Jefferson Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bull City, or 14 miles west of Hueytown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Bessemer, Homewood, Hueytown, Fairfield, Pleasant Grove, Midfield, Adamsville, Brighton, Lipscomb, Lake View, Sylvan Springs, Mulga, Maytown, North Johns, Birmingham Fairgounds, Bull City and Abernant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
